1.brief: ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
to bear young; causatively, to beget; medically, to act as midwife; specifically, to show lineage
short (whether in size, number, life, strength or temper)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
satiated (in a pleasant or disagreeable sense)
commotion, restlessness (of a horse), crash (of thunder), disquiet, anger

2.brief: properly, glistening, i.e. a burnished plate; also a flower (as bright-colored); a wing (as gleaming in the air)
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
to bolt, i.e. figuratively, to flee suddenly
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)

3.brief: meaning accession (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or yea; adversatively though
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
to open (the senses, especially the eyes); figuratively, to be observant
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)

4.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
pure (in a physical, chemical, ceremonial or moral sense)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, united, i.e. one; or (as an ordinal) first

5.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
properly, to point sharply, i.e. (literally) to wound; figuratively, to be alert, to decide
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
a number, definite (arithmetical) or indefinite (large, innumerable; small, a few); also (abstractly) narration
the new moon; by implication, a month
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
an enactment; hence, an appointment (of time, space, quantity, labor or usage)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)

6.brief: to gaze at or about (properly, for help); by implication, to inspect, consider, compassionate, be nonplussed (as looking around in amazement) or bewildered
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, to be flabby, i.e. (by implication) desist; (figuratively) be lacking or idle
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
to be pleased with; specifically, to satisfy adebt
a man at wages  by the day or year
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

7.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
there is or are (or any other form of the verb to be, as may suit the connection)
a tree (from its firmness); hence, wood (plural sticks)
literally a cord (as an attachment); figuratively, expectancy
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
properly, to slide by, i.e. (by implication) to hasten away, pass on, spring up, pierce or change
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to be flabby, i.e. (by implication) desist; (figuratively) be lacking or idle

8.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud
to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill
the trunk or stump of atree (as felled or as planted)

9.brief: water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
to break forth as a bud, i.e. bloom; generally, to spread; specifically, to fly (as extending the wings); figuratively, to flourish
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
severed, i.e. harvest (as reaped), the crop, the time, the reaper, or figuratively; also a limb (of a tree, or simply foliage)
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
a plant; collectively, a plantation; abstractly, a planting

10.brief: properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply
to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill
to prostrate; by implication, to overthrow, decay
to breathe out, i.e. (by implication) expire
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)

11.brief: to go away, hence, to disappear
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
a stream (including the sea; expectation the Nile, Euphrates, etc.); figuratively, prosperity
to parch (through drought) i.e. (by analogy,) to desolate, destroy, kill
to be ashamed, confused or disappointed; also (as failing) to dry up (as water) or wither (as herbage)

12.brief: a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
to lie down (for rest, sexual connection, decease or any other purpose)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
properly, a failure of, i.e. (used only as a negative particle, usually with a prepositional prefix) not, except, without, unless, besides, because not, until, etc.
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

13.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates
to hide (by covering over); by implication, to hoard or reserve; figuratively to deny; specifically (favorably) to protect, (unfavorably) to lurk
to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
to place (in a very wide application)
an enactment; hence, an appointment (of time, space, quantity, labor or usage)
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male

14.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill
properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply
to live, whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to revive
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
to wait; by implication, to be patient, hope
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

15.brief: to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
properly, to become pale, i.e. (by implication) to pine after; also to fear

16.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
an offence (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its penalty, occasion, sacrifice, or expiation; also (concretely) an offender

17.brief: to close up; especially to seal
a parcel (as packed up); also a kernel or particle (as if a package)
properly, to stick on as apatch; figuratively, to impute falsely
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

18.brief: a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
to wilt; generally, to fall away, fail, faint; figuratively, to be foolish or (morally) wicked; causatively, to despise, disgrace
properly, a cliff (or sharp rock, as compressed); generally, a rock or boulder; figuratively, a refuge; also an edge (as precipitous)
to remove (intransitive or transitive) figuratively, to grow old; specifically, to transcribe
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)

19.brief: water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
to gush; by implication, to inundate, cleanse; by analogy, to gallop, conquer
something (spontaneously) falling off, i.e. a self-sown crop; figuratively, a freshet
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
literally a cord (as an attachment); figuratively, expectancy
a man in general (singly or collectively)
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)

20.brief: properly, a goal, i.e. the bright object at adistance travelled towards; hence (figuratively), splendor, or (subjectively) truthfulness, or (objectively) confidence; but usually (adverbially), continually (i.e. to the most distant point of view)
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
to fold, i.e. duplicate (literally or figuratively); by implication, to transmute (transitive or intransitive)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)

21.brief: to be heavy, i.e. in a bad sense (burdensome, severe, dull) or in a good sense (numerous, rich, honorable; causatively, to make weighty (in the same two senses)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand

22.brief: a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, to feel pain; by implication, to grieve; figuratively, to spoil
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
